intro: Polyalthia khaoyaiensis, commonly known as the Khaoyai polyalthia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
